title: Real Life Example
text: To demonstrate a practical example of using arrays, let's create a program that calculates the average of different ages:
And in this example, we create a program that finds the lowest age among different ages:

Example

  // An array storing different agesint ages[8] = {20, 22, 18, 35, 48, 26, 
  87, 70};int i;// Get the length of the arrayint length = 
  sizeof(ages) / sizeof(ages[0]);// Create a variable and assign the 
  first array element of ages to itint lowestAge = ages[0];// Loop 
  through the elements of the ages array to find the lowest agefor (int age 
  : ages) {  if (lowestAge > age) {    lowestAge = 
  age;  }}// Print the lowest agecout << "The lowest 
  age is: " << lowestAge << "\n";
